twitch_info.title: I wanna Gaze at the Horizon - Any-Penalties% - 4:40:43.53 (Full Broadcast)
twitch_info.description: This is for all the chat that occurred during the run, including the beginning portion of the stream. The other highlight is the one that will be given for those wanting to watch the YouTube posted run that will eventually be posted (posted by the time you read this some time tomorrow most likely).

message.body: let's hope this is a good run today
I've gave the game a solid week break to let my practice settle in.
why am I so bad at needle rn
*there says gaze at the horizon not slimepark
stage 2 been bad today so far
First time I done that successfully
used the notepad method for that one attack
this is a pretty long game
how many keypicks are there in this stage and how many to go?
then you get two hard screens
oh is there no saves or does it autosave?
but this is the last one before two hard screens
now you know what I mean
The other ones are easy because I worked them out already and got them on-hand
THIS one the other hand is not
hi, can I say my way of doing this screen? KonCha
that explains why this split is so long
do gate jumps all the way, with a diamond at the end
to be honest I dont' mind doing diamonds
can I really gate that conssitently
if youre really good, you can do all double diamonds
sometimes I do it first try
this whole keypick stage doesnt inspire much, its just a bunch of corridors
so this is his first version of keypick?
is his first version of everything
makes sense that this isnt as polished as keypick 100
today's a bad day for this portion it seems
looks like most important to skip are red and yellow
that's why I had my strat
really am getting unlucky today lul
and so are diamonds rn apparently
why are you doing this twice?
cause its one of the penalties
this save is always a problem
The soundtrack fot this one is pretty awesome just saying xD
It just keeps on giving the track is actually really long
It's nice that it restarts on changing screen you can easily know if you're losing time
This is gonna be a massive pb
my PB is also the wr xd
nobody else is insane enough to run this atm xD
Each screen looks scarier than the previous one in this stage
"the Day when eradem gonna have a profile picture all puzzle games are gonna be a bronze level for him" gl x2 xd
Profile pictures are the hardest puzzle
you never know if is Best have a anime girl or a furry xd
Just have both at the same time
I hope I didn't screw up
this screen is the worst one imo
Sketchy but you don't mess it up so it's all good
normally I first try that other screen
The last ones look like such a mess
I probably won't get it, final boss is n a s t y
The wait is always so long lmao
Really makes you question yourself every time.
It didn't shoot the 3rd time that was great
That's a gold I ain't beating any time soon.
No you did once to the first attack and twice to the second and that's it
was a combination of my WeirdChamp run
Solid for a third completed run
This PB will be VERY hard to beat now
The only noticeable issue in this run that would save me a lot of time
is stage 5 around and around screen
But that was bad luck really
I usually first try it after all
oh and I could save time on gates & diamonds stage 7 pre-final screen.
But you can always save time there, let's be real.
I could also save time on that one stage 8 screen I kept redoing.
Which was again unusual as usually first try.
increased so high during that ending
Actually felt it beating this time LUL
Only reason I could deal witih that reaction.
Is I've played too much 2hu with the same effect happening on lnog lunatic 1cc runs.
Where you HAVE to control it
How low do you think it can go?
But that's about all I can imagine at the moment.
Anything below sub 4 I have no idea.
Where would you save all that time though? There's 10 minutes in save 5 but where would you get the other 40?
If you can't actually sub 4, then good golly.
I guess you can save 10 minutes if you first try the gates and diamonds and corners
And 10 more if you first try every stage 8 screen
Yeah, you probably can't actually sub 4 huh
There's lots of time save potential in stage 3
Stage 3 is the most garbage stage though.
Every time I get past stage 3 I'm like "YES, I'M PAST IT!"
It's just that bad to me.
Fortunately it's in the first hour of the run
At least sub 4 seems possible actually with a really good run
Sub 4 is genuinely possible - at least what I feel deep down.
But as for actually doing that... It's basically god tier.
But yeah, you can definitely save more time at the beginning stages of the game.
If that happens, I'm going to be super shocked.
Decreasing the current time in next run maybe?
I think with enough dedication, practice and attempts, I can get it.
But I don't think we'll be seeing as huge leaps and bounds in progress at that point.
More like minor adjustments and t he likes.
I think I'll still attempt it as usual though.
I do like running this game (except stage 3, that can go delete itself).
I've also basically pulled a Naloa here lmao.
First SAN run good but long, second SAN run, goes overtime, third SAN run beats the first and second SAN run super far.
And that's what I've done here in Horizon. XD
Your second run was like seconds slower than the first one
yeah, I guess he went a bit further beyond in overtime.
Though I do find it amusing that both me and him basically gold split the final boss on our respective games XD
As you can see by mad selector, I also cleared Pahe since last time.
Posted the vid on my youtube yee.
Yeah, Pahe took longer than expected.
So now you can do a mad run without having to beat Pahe?
The boss itself wasn't too bad and was fun to grind, but the needle sometimes drained hours of my time for no reason.
Mad is the entire game without saves, no checkpoints etc
Yeah the needle looked like the not-fun part
The needle was fine but also not fine.
Every so often you got the needle down multiple times in a row, and then randomly you lose an hour of your lfie.
I also find it amusing that my first clear file (now my practice file as I use it to practice things) has such a large time spent compared to each of my speedrun saves. xD
It's just funny to me. xd
It's even more noticeable in puzzle games
Btw, if I ever clear SlimePark, I might run that as well.
I can currently run SlimePark to floor 62 in 40 minutes.
But I haven't finished the rest of the game past floor 62 yet, or floor 62 itself. That may be a while to figure out.
It's most screens all first try.
SlimePark floors 51-61 are my favourite atm
It's all execution and no RNG
No boss to ruin the day
That much I do know. XD
Yeah, that's where I suspect most of my time will get eaten when I run the game for real (after having figured out all the puzzles and cleared the game).
As in a 6-minute RNG boss at the end of the run?
Maybe it won't be as bad as it could be
But yeah RNG boss at the end
with the same destination final attack basically
But yeah, I don't think the boss will be easy
As long as the bullets are all normal and there's no pink ones
all the bullets are coloured even.
So imagine accidentally shooting one that blows up.
That won't ever happen on good pace run
I don't think SlimePark final boss will be anything to sneeze at.
Probably will eat time away lots of times.
Nick24 did a run of the game b tw
Though if I know anything about Nick's times. They're usually very beatable. Unless he grinds way too much like he did with timemachine 2 lunatic.
I mean I cut Nick's time on ToBoss6% on Horizon by uh
Weren't you going for that record too?
A while ago, but I beat thatt record on my very first run.
So I didn't really need to worry about it.
To boss6% might not exist now that boss 6 is basically free
Yeah, boss 8 is the not free one lmao
I knew when I cleared boss 8 past upside down first try
That I would first try final boss ending.
Every time that's how it goes down in practice.
You already nearly first tried the first run too
In practice, I usually beat the final boss as fast as you saw it.
Just that normally doesn't happen in runs.
But this time I pulled it off in a real run.
Like as if my practice from stage 8 boss and final boss actually became realised.
Yeah, I also took a week break.
A full week of no Horizon.
Since the last one I did was on Saturday
Except this wasn't even a derust run.
Except for like, a tiny couple of moments.
Where I just forgot what I was doing. xD
But I figured it out again quickly enough that it didn't really matter.
Stage 2 also went by pretty poorly this run
Stage 4 had some issues that made me go :hmmmmmmm:
So there's almost certainly time save for sub 4 thinking about it.
But that'll be like Ao/Blue kind of execution. XD
Maybe I'll manage it some time.
Sub 4 this game might be comparable to Destination sub 1.
You definitively can get it if RNG is not awful
stage 3 boss RNG was free this run
Back when I first did runs of the game (not full runs of the game), I used to find the third boss free every time.
But evetually I found out its RNG can be actual garbage.
And then from there the boss decided to deck me for 2 full runs.
And in practice the boss also hated me.
Seeing the boss actually be free this time was a breath of fresh air.
Final boss rng wastes more time overall.
As far as a speedrun is concerned, losing a couple minutes on boss 3 is acceptable.
That RNG can really be bad.
Also it gave me a really bad attack that run.
One that I usually fail every time.
Come to think of it, the stage 5 boss did the same thing
I still can't believe I cleared the t-bone vortex LUL
And I love how the attack before that vortex was the v-string jump.
That boss really did not want me to clear.
I think those were literally the hardest attacks it could choose.
It saved you from bad RNG
It seems the final boss thought similarily.
They gave me free RNG, only to try and ruin me with the weird attack.
Except it failed and I cleared.
That jump is stupidly precise as well.
So that's two stupidly precise jumps Icleared in that run.
yeah, I believe that was again one of the hardest ones that could've been chosen by Zoid.
Of course, Zoid could've chosen diamond rush.
That really bad long jump one
Crescent, that weird attack, diamond rush and Trophy are the hardest ones.
The other two weird attacks are free in comparison.
The drop one looks bad too
It's actually freer than it looks.
If you drop off, then double jump, you can basically clear it with no issue.
Problem is I often fail the execution.
Because I see the attack and go
"OOOH BOY IT'S A HARD WEIRD ONE"
and then usually die on the first jump XD
But it's definitely not as hard as it looks.
The other weird attack that's really close to the ceiling gives you plenty of jump room
But the one I was given this time
It's basically attempting the spike skip in games
You know when you have the two blocks then two spikes on top of it, and you gotta jump over the two spikes?
That's what the weird attack I cleared this time basically is.
As I said, it's really nasty.
It's basically on par with Crescent and Trophy.
Which is the reason why I was so surprised I cleared that.
I didn't say anything at the time cause it was i nthe run obviously.
Plus I got free rng for first attack of stage 6 segment.
Allowing me full focus for the second attack.
that one was not free, but it was kind enough to me to give me the starting point as not about to kill me.
Yeah stage 6 looks nicer than usual
yeah in Zoid it was much nicer
stage 8 portion REALLY tried to kill me
I was given most of the hardest stage 8 attacks.
and expected to react to most of them while upside down.
The final 3 attacks I was praying I would get through
Because I already did all the insane shit
The most scary ones are when upside down wants you to touch the floor.
You'd think it be normal to regular upright, but here's the thing.
Regular upright is precise too if you go that high.
But imagine working that out while upside down.
Snice you need to know the precise jump heights
and I mean that's on top of figuring out the pattern.
So when I was given actual hard upside down patterns in that finale.
Do you have more time to react during the final boss?
And because it's the same time to react.
The same precision is required for every attack.
It's pretty much literally stage 8 boss b ut at the end of the final boss and with flipping gravity every attack.
Only spin on it for Zoid is the flipping gravity.
That must be great to see the first time
You do have time not to instagib.
Because the transition from the stage 8 intro in final boss to the actual attack is pretty abrupt.
As is the stage 7 portion to stage 8.
I might've made it through 1 or 2 attacks and not instagibbed though first t ime.
I didn't get far, but probably 1 or 2 attacks.
Yeah, I definitely lasted long enough to see the gravity flip.
I like the little animation just before the stage 8 attack on the last boss
It makes that final attack really feel grandiose and like an actual finale.
Rather than just shoving it in.
And you know it's the last attack and you will suffer
And well it does exactly that
Until you've practiced stage 8 boss enough times.
Which is why my policy has been to always practice stage 8 boss before final, to check if my skill is on par.
Because if it isn't, there is zero point playing final boss.
Which again leads to why I thought "wait, final first try might actually happen" when I cleared stage 8 boss upside down first try.
I was literally clearing the final boss and stage 8 boss on the regular and so quickly.
It didn't pay off at all on the previous run, but I thought of that as my derust run.
Because I hadn't played the full game in a while.
It ended up being the weirdest run
That I've ever done on this game. xD
At least this one finally hit the nail.
JFC that time save on final boss LUL
Anyway, that concludes Horizon for t onight obviously.
However, I may run some timemachine 2 now.
Gonna go eat something first tho
Better get some energy back after that
I'll re-stream when I start doing the runs.
